methods.name: build()
methods.description: Builds the chart.

methods.name: reverseCategories()
methods.description:
Reverses the drawing of series in the domain axis. For vertical-range charts (such as line,
area or column charts), this means the horizontal axis is drawn from right to left. For
horizontal-range charts (such as bar charts), this means the vertical axis is drawn from top to
bottom. For pie charts, this means the slices are drawn counterclockwise.

parameters.name: cssValue
parameters.description: The CSS value for the color (such as"blue"or"#00f").

methods.name: setBackgroundColor(cssValue)
methods.description: Sets the background color for the chart.

parameters.name: cssValues
parameters.description:
An array of color CSS values, such as["red", "#acf"]. The nth element
    in the array represents the color of the nth line in the chart.

methods.name: setColors(cssValues)
methods.description: Sets the colors for the lines in the chart.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The data source URL, including any query parameters.

methods.name: setDataSourceUrl(url)
methods.description:
Sets the data source URL that is used to pull data in from an external source, such as Google
Sheets. If a data source URL and a DataTable are provided, the data source URL is ignored.

parameters.name: tableBuilder
parameters.description:
A data table builder. A new data table is created instantly as part of this
    call, so any further updates to the builder won't be reflected in the chart.

methods.name: setDataTable(tableBuilder)
methods.description:
Sets the data table to use for the chart using a DataTableBuilder. This is a convenience method
for setting the data table without needing to callbuild().

parameters.name: table
parameters.description: The data table to use for the chart.

methods.name: setDataTable(table)
methods.description:
Sets the data table which contains the lines for the chart, as well as the X-axis labels. The
first column should be a string, and contain the horizontal axis labels. Any number of columns
can follow, all must be numeric. Each column is displayed as a separate line.

parameters.name: dataViewDefinition
parameters.description:
A data view definition object that defines the view that should be
    derived from the given data source for the chart drawing.

methods.name: setDataViewDefinition(dataViewDefinition)
methods.description: Sets the data view definition to use for the chart.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The width of the chart, in pixels.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The height of the chart, in pixels.

methods.name: setDimensions(width, height)
methods.description: Sets the dimensions for the chart.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: The position of the legend.

methods.name: setLegendPosition(position)
methods.description: Sets the position of the legend with respect to the chart. By default, there is no legend.

parameters.name: textStyle
parameters.description: The text style to use for the chart legend.

methods.name: setLegendTextStyle(textStyle)
methods.description: Sets the text style of the chart legend.

parameters.name: option
parameters.description: The option to set.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value to set.

methods.name: setOption(option, value)
methods.description:
Sets advanced options for this chart. Seethe available options for
this chart. This method has no effect if the given option is invalid.

parameters.name: style
parameters.description: The style to use for points in the line.

methods.name: setPointStyle(style)
methods.description:
Sets the style for points in the line. By default, points have no particular styles, and only
the line is visible.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The value for the lowest grid line of the range axis.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: The value for the highest grid line of the range axis.

methods.name: setRange(start, end)
methods.description: Sets the range for the chart.

methods.name: setStacked()
methods.description:
Uses stacked lines, meaning that line and bar values are stacked (accumulated). By default,
there is no stacking.

parameters.name: chartTitle
parameters.description: the chart title.

methods.name: setTitle(chartTitle)
methods.description: Sets the title of the chart. The title is displayed centered above the chart.

parameters.name: textStyle
parameters.description: The text style to use for the chart title. You can create aTextStyleBuilderobject by callingCharts.newTextStyle().

methods.name: setTitleTextStyle(textStyle)
methods.description: Sets the text style of the chart title.

parameters.name: textStyle
parameters.description: The text style to use for the horizontal axis title. You can create aTextStyleBuilderobject by callingCharts.newTextStyle().

methods.name: setXAxisTextStyle(textStyle)
methods.description: Sets the horizontal axis text style.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The title for the X-axis.

methods.name: setXAxisTitle(title)
methods.description:
Adds a title to the horizontal axis. The title is centered and appears below the axis value
labels.

parameters.name: textStyle
parameters.description: The text style to use for the horizontal axis title. You can create aTextStyleBuilderobject by callingCharts.newTextStyle().

methods.name: setXAxisTitleTextStyle(textStyle)
methods.description: Sets the horizontal axis title text style.

parameters.name: textStyle
parameters.description: The text style to use for the horizontal axis title. You can create aTextStyleBuilderobject by callingCharts.newTextStyle().

methods.name: setYAxisTextStyle(textStyle)
methods.description: Sets the vertical axis text style.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The title for the Y-axis.

methods.name: setYAxisTitle(title)
methods.description:
Adds a title to the vertical axis. The title is centered and appears to the left of the value
labels.

parameters.name: textStyle
parameters.description: The text style to use for the horizontal axis title. You can create aTextStyleBuilderobject by callingCharts.newTextStyle().

methods.name: setYAxisTitleTextStyle(textStyle)
methods.description: Sets the vertical axis title text style.

methods.name: useLogScale()
methods.description:
Makes the range axis into a logarithmic scale (requires all values to be positive). The range
axis are the vertical axis for vertical charts (such as line, area, or column) and the
horizontal axis for horizontal charts (such as bar).

methods.name: build()
methods.description: Builds the chart.

methods.name: reverseCategories()
methods.description:
Reverses the drawing of series in the domain axis. For vertical-range charts (such as line,
area or column charts), this means the horizontal axis is drawn from right to left. For
horizontal-range charts (such as bar charts), this means the vertical axis is drawn from top to
bottom. For pie charts, this means the slices are drawn counterclockwise.

methods.name: reverseDirection()
methods.description:
Reverses the direction in which the bars grow along the horizontal axis. By default, values
grow from left to right. Calling this method causes them to grow from right to left.

parameters.name: cssValue
parameters.description: The CSS value for the color (such as"blue"or"#00f").

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description:
The MIME type to convert to. For most blobs,'application/pdf'is
    the only valid option. For images in BMP, GIF, JPEG, or PNG format, any of'image/bmp','image/gif','image/jpeg', or'image/png'are also
    valid. For a Google Docs document,'text/markdown'is also valid.

methods.name: getAs(contentType)
methods.description:
Return the data inside this object as a blob converted to the specified content type. This
method adds the appropriate extension to the filenameâ€”for example, "myfile.pdf". However, it
assumes that the part of the filename that follows the last period (if any) is an existing
extension that should be replaced. Consequently, "ShoppingList.12.25.2014" becomes
"ShoppingList.12.25.pdf".

methods.name: getBlob()
methods.description: Return the data inside this object as a blob.

methods.name: getOptions()
methods.description: Returns the options for this chart, such as height, colors, and axes.

enum_members.name: IGNORE_BOTH
enum_members.description: Default; charts skips any hidden columns and hidden rows.

enum_members.name: SHOW_BOTH
enum_members.description: Charts does not skip hidden columns or hidden rows.

enum_members.name: MERGE_COLUMNS
enum_members.description: Default. Charts merges the columns of multiple ranges.

enum_members.name: MERGE_ROWS
enum_members.description: Charts merges the rows of multiple ranges.

parameters.name: option
parameters.description: The string representing the desired option.

methods.name: get(option)
methods.description: Returns a configured option for this chart.

parameters.name: option
parameters.description: The string representing the desired option.

methods.name: getOrDefault(option)
methods.description:
Returns a configured option for this chart. If the chart option is not set, returns the default
value of this option if available, or returnsnullif the default value is not
available.

methods.name: newAreaChart()
methods.description:
Starts building an area chart, as described in theGoogle Chart
Toolsdocumentation.

methods.name: newBarChart()
methods.description:
Starts building a bar chart, as described in theGoogle Chart
Toolsdocumentation.

methods.name: newColumnChart()
methods.description:
Starts building a column chart, as described in theGoogle Chart
Toolsdocumentation.

methods.name: newDataTable()
methods.description: Creates an empty data table, which can have its values set manually.

methods.name: newDataViewDefinition()
methods.description: Creates a new data view definition.

methods.name: newLineChart()
methods.description:
Starts building a line chart, as described in theGoogle Chart
Toolsdocumentation.

methods.name: newPieChart()
methods.description:
Starts building a pie chart, as described in theGoogle Chart
Toolsdocumentation.

methods.name: newScatterChart()
methods.description:
Starts building a scatter chart, as described in theGoogle Chart
Toolsdocumentation.

methods.name: newTableChart()
methods.description:
Starts building a table chart, as described in theGoogle Chart
Toolsdocumentation.

methods.name: newTextStyle()
methods.description: Creates a new text style builder.

methods.description: Builds the chart.

enum_members.name: SMOOTH
enum_members.description: The angles of the line are smoothed.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: type of data in the column (number, string, or date)

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: label of the column (it's used for chart legends).

methods.name: addColumn(type, label)
methods.description: Adds a column to the data table. Columns will be added from 0 to n.

parameters.name: values
parameters.description: values for the row, specified in the same order that the columns are entered.

methods.name: addRow(values)
methods.description: Adds a row to the data table.

methods.name: build()
methods.description: Builds and returns a data table.

parameters.name: row
parameters.description: the row index (the first row has index 0)

parameters.name: column
parameters.description: the column index (the first column has index 0)

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: the value of the table cell (should have the right type for the column).

methods.name: setValue(row, column, value)
methods.description: Sets a specific value in the table.

methods.name: getDataTable()
methods.description: Return the data inside this object as a DataTable.

methods.name: build()
methods.description: Builds and returns the data view definition object that was built using this builder.

parameters.name: columns
parameters.description:
An array of column indexes, or column descriptions (an object), to include in
    the data view. The column descriptions define a column role. The data table and the
    enumeration for data view columns are zero-based.

methods.name: setColumns(columns)
methods.description:
Sets the indexes of the columns to include in the data view as well as specifying role-column
information. This subset of column indexes refer to the columns of the data source that the
data view is derived from.

methods.name: build()
methods.description: Builds the chart.

methods.name: reverseCategories()
methods.description:
Reverses the drawing of series in the domain axis. For vertical-range charts (such as line,
area or column charts), this means the horizontal axis is drawn from right to left. For
horizontal-range charts (such as bar charts), this means the vertical axis is drawn from top to
bottom. For pie charts, this means the slices are drawn counterclockwise.

    in the array represents the color of the nth line in the chart.

methods.description: Sets the colors for the lines in the chart.

parameters.name: style
parameters.description: The style for curves in the chart.

methods.name: setCurveStyle(style)
methods.description:
Sets the style to use for curves in the chart. SeeCurveStylefor allowed curve
styles.

enum_members.name: PREFIX
enum_members.description: Match prefixes starting from the beginning of the value

parameters.name: maxValue
parameters.description: The maximum value of the slider.

methods.name: setMaxValue(maxValue)
methods.description:
Sets the maximum allowed value for the range lower extent. If undefined, the value is inferred
from the contents of the DataTable managed by the control.

parameters.name: minValue
parameters.description: The minimum value of the slider.

methods.name: setMinValue(minValue)
methods.description:
Sets the minimum allowed value for the range lower extent. If undefined, the value is inferred
from the contents of the DataTable managed by the control.

parameters.name: orientation
parameters.description: The slider orientation to set.

methods.name: setOrientation(orientation)
methods.description: Sets the slider orientation.

parameters.name: showRangeValues
parameters.description: Iftrue, enables showing of labels next to the slider.

methods.name: setShowRangeValues(showRangeValues)
methods.description: Sets whether to have labels next to the slider displaying extents of the selected range.

parameters.name: ticks
parameters.description: The number of ticks on the slider.

methods.name: setTicks(ticks)
methods.description:
Sets the number of ticks (fixed positions in a range bar) a number range filter slider thumbs
can fall in.

enum_members.name: ASIDE
enum_members.description: Selected values display in a single text line next to the value picker widget.

enum_members.name: BELOW
enum_members.description: Selected values display in a single text line below the widget.

enum_members.name: BELOW_WRAPPING
enum_members.description: Similar to below, but entries that cannot fit in the picker wrap to a new line.

enum_members.name: BELOW_STACKED
enum_members.description: Selected values display in a column below the widget.

methods.name: build()
methods.description: Builds the chart.

methods.name: reverseCategories()
methods.description:
Reverses the drawing of series in the domain axis. For vertical-range charts (such as line,
area or column charts), this means the horizontal axis is drawn from right to left. For
horizontal-range charts (such as bar charts), this means the vertical axis is drawn from top to
bottom. For pie charts, this means the slices are drawn counterclockwise.

methods.name: set3D()
methods.description: Sets the chart to be three-dimensional.

parameters.name: cssValue
parameters.description: The CSS value for the color (such as"blue"or"#00f").

methods.name: setBackgroundColor(cssValue)
methods.description: Sets the background color for the chart.

parameters.name: cssValues
parameters.description:
An array of color CSS values, such as["red", "#acf"]. The nth element
    in the array represents the color of the nth line in the chart.

methods.name: setColors(cssValues)
methods.description: Sets the colors for the lines in the chart.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The data source URL, including any query parameters.

methods.name: setDataSourceUrl(url)
methods.description:
Sets the data source URL that is used to pull data in from an external source, such as Google
Sheets. If a data source URL and a DataTable are provided, the data source URL is ignored.

parameters.name: tableBuilder
parameters.description:
A data table builder. A new data table is created instantly as part of this
    call, so any further updates to the builder won't be reflected in the chart.

methods.name: setDataTable(tableBuilder)
methods.description:
Sets the data table to use for the chart using a DataTableBuilder. This is a convenience method
for setting the data table without needing to callbuild().

parameters.name: table
parameters.description: The data table to use for the chart.

methods.name: setDataTable(table)
methods.description:
Sets the data table which contains the lines for the chart, as well as the X-axis labels. The
first column should be a string, and contain the horizontal axis labels. Any number of columns
can follow, all must be numeric. Each column is displayed as a separate line.

parameters.name: dataViewDefinition
parameters.description:
A data view definition object that defines the view that should be
    derived from the given data source for the chart drawing.

methods.name: setDataViewDefinition(dataViewDefinition)
methods.description: Sets the data view definition to use for the chart.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The width of the chart, in pixels.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The height of the chart, in pixels.

methods.name: setDimensions(width, height)
methods.description: Sets the dimensions for the chart.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: The position of the legend.

methods.name: setLegendPosition(position)
methods.description: Sets the position of the legend with respect to the chart. By default, there is no legend.

parameters.name: textStyle
parameters.description: The text style to use for the chart legend.

methods.name: setLegendTextStyle(textStyle)
methods.description: Sets the text style of the chart legend.

parameters.name: option
parameters.description: The option to set.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value to set.

methods.name: setOption(option, value)
methods.description:
Sets advanced options for this chart. Seethe available options for
this chart. This method has no effect if the given option is invalid.

parameters.name: chartTitle
parameters.description: the chart title.

methods.name: setTitle(chartTitle)
methods.description: Sets the title of the chart. The title is displayed centered above the chart.

parameters.name: textStyle
parameters.description: The text style to use for the chart title. You can create aTextStyleBuilderobject by callingCharts.newTextStyle().

methods.name: setTitleTextStyle(textStyle)
methods.description: Sets the text style of the chart title.

enum_members.name: RIGHT
enum_members.description: To the right of the chart.

methods.name: build()
methods.description: Builds the chart.

parameters.name: cssValue
parameters.description: The CSS value for the color (such as"blue"or"#00f").

methods.name: setBackgroundColor(cssValue)
methods.description: Sets the background color for the chart.

parameters.name: cssValues
parameters.description:
An array of color CSS values, such as["red", "#acf"]. The nth element
    in the array represents the color of the nth line in the chart.

parameters.description: The data source URL, including any query parameters.

methods.name: setDataSourceUrl(url)

Sheets. If a data source URL and a DataTable are provided, the data source URL is ignored.

    call, so any further updates to the builder won't be reflected in the chart.

methods.name: setDataTable(tableBuilder)

for setting the data table without needing to callbuild().

parameters.description: The data table to use for the chart.

methods.name: setDataTable(table)
methods.description:
Sets the data table which contains the lines for the chart, as well as the X-axis labels. The
first column should be a string, and contain the horizontal axis labels. Any number of columns
can follow, all must be numeric. Each column is displayed as a separate line.

A data view definition object that defines the view that should be
    derived from the given data source for the chart drawing.

methods.name: setDataViewDefinition(dataViewDefinition)

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The width of the chart, in pixels.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The height of the chart, in pixels.

methods.name: setDimensions(width, height)
methods.description: Sets the dimensions for the chart.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: The position of the legend.

methods.name: setLegendPosition(position)
methods.description: Sets the position of the legend with respect to the chart. By default, there is no legend.

parameters.name: textStyle
parameters.description: The text style to use for the chart legend.

methods.name: setLegendTextStyle(textStyle)
methods.description: Sets the text style of the chart legend.

parameters.name: option
parameters.description: The option to set.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value to set.

methods.name: setOption(option, value)
methods.description:
Sets advanced options for this chart. Seethe available options for
this chart. This method has no effect if the given option is invalid.

parameters.name: style
parameters.description: The style to use for points in the line.

methods.name: setPointStyle(style)
methods.description:
Sets the style for points in the line. By default, points have no particular styles, and only
the line is visible.

parameters.name: chartTitle
parameters.description: the chart title.

methods.name: setTitle(chartTitle)
methods.description: Sets the title of the chart. The title is displayed centered above the chart.

parameters.name: textStyle
parameters.description: The text style to use for the chart title. You can create aTextStyleBuilderobject by callingCharts.newTextStyle().

methods.name: setTitleTextStyle(textStyle)
methods.description: Sets the text style of the chart title.

methods.name: setXAxisLogScale()
methods.description: Makes the horizontal axis into a logarithmic scale (requires all values to be positive).

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The value for the lowest grid line of the horizontal axis.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: The value for the highest grid line of the horizontal axis.

methods.name: setXAxisRange(start, end)
methods.description: Sets the range for the horizontal axis of the chart.

parameters.name: textStyle
parameters.description: The text style to use for the horizontal axis title. You can create aTextStyleBuilderobject by callingCharts.newTextStyle().

methods.name: setXAxisTextStyle(textStyle)
methods.description: Sets the horizontal axis text style.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The title for the X-axis.

methods.name: setXAxisTitle(title)
methods.description:
Adds a title to the horizontal axis. The title is centered and appears below the axis value
labels.

parameters.name: textStyle
parameters.description: The text style to use for the horizontal axis title. You can create aTextStyleBuilderobject by callingCharts.newTextStyle().

methods.name: setXAxisTitleTextStyle(textStyle)
methods.description: Sets the horizontal axis title text style.

methods.name: setYAxisLogScale()
methods.description: Makes the vertical axis into a logarithmic scale (requires all values to be positive).

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The value for the lowest grid line of the vertical axis.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: The value for the highest grid line of the vertical axis.

methods.name: setYAxisRange(start, end)
methods.description:
Sets the range for the vertical axis of the chart. If any data points fall outside the range,
the range is expanded to include those data points.

parameters.name: textStyle
parameters.description: The text style to use for the horizontal axis title. You can create aTextStyleBuilderobject by callingCharts.newTextStyle().

methods.name: setYAxisTextStyle(textStyle)
methods.description: Sets the vertical axis text style.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The title for the Y-axis.

methods.name: setYAxisTitle(title)
methods.description:
Adds a title to the vertical axis. The title is centered and appears to the left of the value
labels.

parameters.name: textStyle
parameters.description: The text style to use for the horizontal axis title. You can create aTextStyleBuilderobject by callingCharts.newTextStyle().

methods.name: setYAxisTitleTextStyle(textStyle)
methods.description: Sets the vertical axis title text style.

parameters.name: caseSensitive
parameters.description: Iftrue, enables string matching case sensitivity.

methods.name: setCaseSensitive(caseSensitive)
methods.description: Sets whether matching should be case sensitive or not.

parameters.name: matchType
parameters.description: The string matching type.

methods.name: setMatchType(matchType)
methods.description:
Sets whether the control should match exact values only (MatchType.EXACT), prefixes
starting from the beginning of the value (MatchType.PREFIX), or any substring
(MatchType.ANY).

parameters.name: realtimeTrigger
parameters.description:
Iftrue, sets events to be triggered at real time (when a key is
    pressed).

methods.name: setRealtimeTrigger(realtimeTrigger)
methods.description:
Sets whether the control should match any time a key is pressed or only when the input field
'changes' (loss of focus or pressing the Enter key).

methods.name: build()
methods.description: Builds the chart.

parameters.name: enablePaging
parameters.description: trueif paging should be enabled,falseotherwise.

methods.name: enablePaging(enablePaging)
methods.description: Sets whether to enable paging through the data.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of rows in each page of the table.

methods.name: enablePaging(pageSize)
methods.description: Enables paging and sets the number of rows in each page.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of rows in each page of the table.

parameters.name: startPage
parameters.description: The first table page to display (page numbers are zero-based).

methods.name: enablePaging(pageSize, startPage)
methods.description:
Enables paging, sets the number of rows in each page and the first table page to display (page
numbers are zero based).

parameters.name: rtlEnabled
parameters.description: trueif right-to-left support should be enabled,falseotherwise.

methods.name: enableRtlTable(rtlEnabled)
methods.description:
Adds basic support for right-to-left languages (such as Arabic or Hebrew) by reversing the
column order of the table, so that column zero is the right-most column, and the last column is
the left-most column.

parameters.name: enableSorting
parameters.description: trueto enable sorting by clicking on column headers,falseotherwise.

methods.name: enableSorting(enableSorting)
methods.description: Sets whether to sort columns when the user clicks a column heading.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The data source URL, including any query parameters.

methods.name: setDataSourceUrl(url)
methods.description:
Sets the data source URL that is used to pull data in from an external source, such as Google
Sheets. If a data source URL and a DataTable are provided, the data source URL is ignored.

A data table builder. A new data table is created instantly as part of this
    call, so any further updates to the builder won't be reflected in the chart.

methods.name: setDataTable(tableBuilder)

Sets the data table to use for the chart using a DataTableBuilder. This is a convenience method
for setting the data table without needing to callbuild().

methods.name: setDataTable(table)

Sets the data table which contains the lines for the chart, as well as the X-axis labels. The
first column should be a string, and contain the horizontal axis labels. Any number of columns
can follow, all must be numeric. Each column is displayed as a separate line.

A data view definition object that defines the view that should be
    derived from the given data source for the chart drawing.

methods.name: setDataViewDefinition(dataViewDefinition)
methods.description: Sets the data view definition to use for the chart.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The width of the chart, in pixels.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The height of the chart, in pixels.

methods.name: setDimensions(width, height)
methods.description: Sets the dimensions for the chart.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The row number for the first row in the data table.

methods.name: setFirstRowNumber(number)
methods.description: Sets the row number for the first row in the data table.

parameters.name: column
parameters.description: The number of the column according to which the table should be initially sorted.

methods.name: setInitialSortingAscending(column)
methods.description:
Sets the index of the column according to which the table should be initially sorted
(ascending).

parameters.name: column
parameters.description: The number of the column according to which the table should be initially sorted.

methods.name: setInitialSortingDescending(column)
methods.description:
Sets the index of the column according to which the table should be initially sorted
(descending).

parameters.name: option
parameters.description: The option to set.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value to set.

methods.name: setOption(option, value)
methods.description:
Sets advanced options for this chart. Seethe available options for
this chart. This method has no effect if the given option is invalid.

parameters.name: showRowNumber
parameters.description: trueif the first column of the table should show the row number,falseotherwise.

methods.name: showRowNumberColumn(showRowNumber)
methods.description: Sets whether to show the row number as the first column of the table.

parameters.name: alternate
parameters.description: trueif color styles should be alternating,falseotherwise.

methods.name: useAlternatingRowStyle(alternate)
methods.description: Sets whether alternating color style is assigned to odd and even rows of a table chart.

methods.name: getColor()
methods.description: Gets the color of the text style.

methods.name: getFontName()
methods.description: Gets the font name of the text style.

methods.name: getFontSize()
methods.description: Gets the font size of the text style.

methods.name: build()
methods.description: Builds and returns a text style configuration object that was built using this builder.

parameters.name: cssValue
parameters.description: The CSS value for the color (such as"blue"or"#00f").

methods.name: setColor(cssValue)
methods.description: Sets the color of the text style.

parameters.name: fontName
parameters.description: The font name to use for the text style.

methods.name: setFontName(fontName)
methods.description: Sets the font name of the text style.

parameters.name: fontSize
parameters.description: The font size in pixels to use for the text style.

methods.name: setFontSize(fontSize)
methods.description: Sets the font size of the text style.
